pullRequest.title: Support OpenId credential for google identification
pullRequest.bodyText:
Allow to login with google's id_token param. This is an additive login method that should work alongside with AuthCode.
This PR is still pending on Core to release the feature.

commit.message: Add coding changes for supporting google's open id

nodes.bodyText: We need public API docs for this, including each enum type + missing license headers
We should probably just rename this to token as the type is determined by the enum?

commit.message:
Change accessToken param to token
Add license and docs to GoogleAuthType

nodes.bodyText: There is an assertFailsWithErrorCode for this pattern. There is still no functionality to match the error though, so you will still have to inspect the error message with .also { e -> e.message.contains} or similar.

commit.message:
Merge branch 'releases' into ct/google-open-id

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            * [RealmApp] Added `Credentials.google(token: String, authType: GoogleAuthType)`, as MongoDB Realm support multiple ways of logging in Google Accounts.

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,19 +1,29 @@
-## 10.1.3 (YYYY-MM-DD)
+## 10.2.0 (2020-12-02)
+
+### Deprecated
+* [RealmApp] `Credentials.google(authenticationCode: String)`. Use `Credentials.google(token: String, authType: GoogleAuthType)` instead.
 
 ### Breaking Changes
 * None.
 
 ### Enhancements
-* None.
+* [RealmApp] Added `Credentials.google(token: String, authType: GoogleAuthType)`, as MongoDB Realm support multiple ways of logging in Google Accounts.
 
 ### Fixes
+* [RealmApp] Bug that would prevent eventual consistency during conflict resolution. Affected clients would experience data divergence and potentially consistency errors as a result if they experienced conflict resolution between cycles of Create-Erase-Create for objects with primary keys.

nodes.bodyText: I guess we should also included the Sync protocol 2 snippet
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,19 +1,29 @@
-## 10.1.3 (YYYY-MM-DD)
+## 10.2.0 (2020-12-02)
+
+### Deprecated
+* [RealmApp] `Credentials.google(authenticationCode: String)`. Use `Credentials.google(token: String, authType: GoogleAuthType)` instead.
 
 ### Breaking Changes
 * None.
 
 ### Enhancements
-* None.
+* [RealmApp] Added `Credentials.google(token: String, authType: GoogleAuthType)`, as MongoDB Realm support multiple ways of logging in Google Accounts.
 
 ### Fixes
+* [RealmApp] Bug that would prevent eventual consistency during conflict resolution. Affected clients would experience data divergence and potentially consistency errors as a result if they experienced conflict resolution between cycles of Create-Erase-Create for objects with primary keys.
+* Complementary fix for missed edge case in https://github.com/realm/realm-java/pull/7220 where KAPT crash if we process a RealmObject referencing a type in RealmList defined in another module. (Issue [#7213](https://github.com/realm/realm-java/issues/7213), since v10.0.0).
 * Clean up JNI references to prevent crash from JNI reference table overflow (Issue [#7217](https://github.com/realm/realm-java/issues/7217))
 
 ### Compatibility
 * File format: Generates Realms with format v20. Unsynced Realms will be upgraded from Realm Java 2.0 and later. Synced Realms can only be read and upgraded if created with Realm Java v10.0.0-BETA.1.
 * APIs are backwards compatible with all previous release of realm-java in the 10.x.y series.
 * Realm Studio 10.0.0 or above is required to open Realms created by this version.
 
+### Internal
+* Updated to Realm Sync: 10.1.4.

nodes.bodyText: Heh. I didn't even get that this was actually the protocol 2 snippet.

 ### Enhancements
-* None.
+* [RealmApp] Added `Credentials.google(token: String, authType: GoogleAuthType)`, as MongoDB Realm support multiple ways of logging in Google Accounts.
 
 ### Fixes
